doc.title: PEP-FOLD

comment.text: PEP-FOLD is a service for the de novo prediction of peptide conformation from amino acid sequence. It is based on a Hidden Markov Model derived Structural Alphabet that describes a conformation a a series of local overlapping canonical conformations. PEP-FOLD 3D generation is performed using a discrete set of structural prototypes, and using the sOPEP coarse-grained force field.
Important: PEP-FOLD will not "discover" disulfide bonds. You have to specify the connectivity of the cysteines.
2011/10/16: New implementation including constraints such as disulfide bonds.
2011/06/21: Improved local prediction engine. New service design.

doc.authors: Shen Y, Maupetit J, Derreumaux P, Tuff√©ry P.
doc.reference: Improved PEP-FOLD approach for peptide and miniprotein structure prediction. J. Chem. Theor. Comput. 2014 Aug 20;10(10):4745-4758.

div.div: Please help us to make PEP-FOLD released. Tell us who you are and if you are interested in a release of PEP-FOLD off-web by signing our guestbook available here.

div.label: Test the service (1jbl PDB entry will be used specifying 3-11 as SS bond constraint, input parameters will be discarded) Yes No

div.div: Use this input field to specify the amino acid sequence of the peptide. It must be in the FASTA format. For more information about the format, please read the sequence format tutorial (Mobyle Tutorials section, on the left). Note: Simulated sequence length must be comprized between 9 and 36 amino-acids. It is possible to specify longer sequences (up to 50 amino acids), but you have to specify a region between 9 and 36 amino acids using the "3D reconstruction range" parameter below.

div.label: Run label

Type of simulation?
long short
Long simulations correspond to 200 runs.
Short simulations correspond to 100 runs.
Usually, for peptides less than 36 amino acids, short simulations will produce results similar to long simulations.

Sort models by?
sOPEP tm
Depending on the selected item, clusters will be sorted by:
sOPEP: sOPEP energy
tm: apollo predicted TM score.
The best models returned will follow this sort.

3D reconstruction range (if needed) (UString)
?
You can use this field to specify the limits of PEP-FOLD 3D simulation for a sequence larger than 36 residues (and not larger than 50 residues).
The limits must be specified on the form: x-y (e.g. 15-45), indicating that the 3D models will encompass the region between residues 15 and 45 (included).
Sequence residues are numbered from 1.
The total size of the simulation (y - x + 1) cannot exceed 36 residues, and the total size of the sequence cannot exceed 50 residues. By default, the complete sequence is considered if nothing is specified (if it is less than 36 residues).
Note: It is best to specify larger sequence and to restrain 3D modelling to a specified region than to truncate the amino acid sequence, because the local structure prediction at N- and C- termini can be affected by the truncation.

Input disulfide bond definition (if any) (UString)
?
If you know the disulfide bond pairings, you can specify them here.
Residues are numbered from 1.
A SS bond between residue 1 and 7 would be specified as: 1-7
Multiple bonds are separated using a ':'. For instance: SS bond between residue (1 and 7) and (21 and 28) would be specified as: 1-7:21-28

Input residue proximities (if any) (UString)
?
If you know residue proximities, you can specify them here. This would enforce energy score when residues are close to each other.
Residues are numbered from 1. A proximity between residue 1 and 7 would be specified as: 1-7

div.div: Specify here a reference structure (PDB Format). It MUST be the same sequence as submitted as input data. If you specify a 3D reconstruction range, the sequence must match exactly the sequence selected.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: Use this input field to specify the amino acid sequence of the peptide. It must be in the FASTA format. For more information about the format, please read the sequence format tutorial (Mobyle Tutorials section, on the left). Note: Simulated sequence length must be comprized between 9 and 36 amino-acids. It is possible to specify longer sequences (up to 50 amino acids), but you have to specify a region between 9 and 36 amino acids using the "3D reconstruction range" parameter below.
Long simulations correspond to 200 runs.
Short simulations correspond to 100 runs.
Usually, for peptides less than 36 amino acids, short simulations will produce results similar to long simulations.
Depending on the selected item, clusters will be sorted by:
sOPEP: sOPEP energy
tm: apollo predicted TM score.
The best models returned will follow this sort.
You can use this field to specify the limits of PEP-FOLD 3D simulation for a sequence larger than 36 residues (and not larger than 50 residues).
The limits must be specified on the form: x-y (e.g. 15-45), indicating that the 3D models will encompass the region between residues 15 and 45 (included).
Sequence residues are numbered from 1.

The total size of the simulation (y - x + 1) cannot exceed 36 residues, and the total size of the sequence cannot exceed 50 residues. By default, the complete sequence is considered if nothing is specified (if it is less than 36 residues).

Note: It is best to specify larger sequence and to restrain 3D modelling to a specified region than to truncate the amino acid sequence, because the local structure prediction at N- and C- termini can be affected by the truncation.
If you know the disulfide bond pairings, you can specify them here.
Residues are numbered from 1.
A SS bond between residue 1 and 7 would be specified as: 1-7
Multiple bonds are separated using a ':'. For instance: SS bond between residue (1 and 7) and (21 and 28) would be specified as: 1-7:21-28
If you know residue proximities, you can specify them here. This would enforce energy score when residues are close to each other.
Residues are numbered from 1. A proximity between residue 1 and 7 would be specified as: 1-7

Specify here a reference structure (PDB Format). It MUST be the same sequence as submitted as input data. If you specify a 3D reconstruction range, the sequence must match exactly the sequence selected.

The visualization is based on top of the Protein Viewer (http://biasmv.github.io/pv/). Being JavaScript / WebGL based, the behavior still depends on the browser (but remains largely better than with JAVA based visualizers).

xhtml:div.style: width:96%; font-size:9pt; border-left:4px solid #cccccc; border-right:4px solid #cccccc; padding: 0 10px 0 10px; text-align:left;
xhtml:div.xhtml:p: To browse the html results page more easily, please click on the full screen view button. Then you can also save it by using File > Save Page as of your web browser.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: Cluster 1 best conformation (according to sort criterion - see the clustering report)
Cluster 2 best conformation (according to sort criterion - see the clustering report)
Cluster 3 best conformation (according to sort criterion - see the clustering report)
Cluster 4 best conformation (according to sort criterion - see the clustering report)
Cluster 5 best conformation (according to sort criterion - see the clustering report)
Structural alphabet (SA)prediction profile.
The probabilities, at each position of the sequence, of the 27 SA letters are sorted from helical (red), coil (blue) to extended (green).
Note: SA letters are 4 residue length, so the profile is of the size of the amino acid sequence minus 3.

div.div: Please help us to make PEP-FOLD released. Tell us who you are and if you are interested in a release of PEP-FOLD off-web by signing our guestbook available here.

parameter.name: demo
parameter.prompt: Test the service (1jbl PDB entry will be used specifying 3-11 as SS bond constraint, input parameters will be discarded)

message.text: You must specify either the demo or input a sequence.
